English (United States)(en-US): Those thoughts may gnaw at you and\nultimately cause you to crumble. … Just like today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 고민들이 너를 갉아먹고, 종국에는,\n무너지게 할 수도 있어. …. 오늘처럼 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s alright to crumble. When I put myself\nback together I’ll be stronger than ever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무너져도 괜찮아. 다시 일어선\n나는 분명 전보다 강해져 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder why. Because I searched to find myself\nin all that time? Because I’ve come closer to myself?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜일까. 그 시간 동안 ‘나’를 찾기 위해 헤매었기\n때문일까? 그렇게 ‘나’에 더 가까워졌기 때문에?

English (United States)(en-US): We could go see the ocean. We could\ntalk to old trees, and find nice gems.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 같이 바다를 보러 갈 수도 있을 거야. 오래된 나무와\n이야기를 할 수도, 예쁜 보석을 발견할 수도 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Why not relish the warm Earth before dying in\nthe sun’s embrace? It would be a happy way to go.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 밝음을 더욱 만끽하다 햇살의 포옹을 받으며\n죽어도 괜찮잖아? 그것도 행복한 죽음일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): But I am a child of the shade. The embrace will\nno doubt be warm… but still uncomfortable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그늘에서 태어났지, 나는. 물론 그\n포옹은 따뜻하겠지만… 약간은 불편할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Some part of me will always\nbe thinking about the shade.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그늘이 자꾸만 떠오를 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And what’s more is that I was gifted life,\ngifted time, and most of all gifted myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더욱이 나는 생을 선물받았고, 시간을\n선물받았고, 무엇보다 ‘나’를 선물받았지.

English (United States)(en-US): There’s nothing more important\nin this life than seeking who I am.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 이 생에서 ‘나’를 찾는\n것보다 중요한 건 없는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): So if that self can only be found in the\ndarkest abyss, I will willingly dive into it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 내가 컴컴한 암흑에서만이 가까스로 추려 낼\n수 있는 존재라면, 기꺼이 그 안으로 뛰어들고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): So have you found yourself, Dot?|.… Was it meaningful?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 너를 찾아 냈어, 뭉치는?|…. 그게 의미 있는 행위였어?

English (United States)(en-US): Have you found the answer to\nall those questions deep within?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 마음속 혼란에 대한 답을 찾아 낸 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): No, and I probably never will.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아마 영원히 찾지 못할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Questions about dreams, the world, its\ncruelty… and myself, the fog asks sharply,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈에 대해, 세계에 대해, 그의 잔혹함에\n대해… 그리고 나의 존재에 대해

English (United States)(en-US): but I couldn’t see an answer among any of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날카로이 캐묻던 안개 속에,\n‘답’ 같은 건 보이지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): So I will never know. For good.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 난 영원히 모를 거야. 정말로.

English (United States)(en-US): But just because there is no answer doesn’t\nmake the search for it meaningless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 답이 없다고 해서 답을\n찾는 행위까지 무의미한 건 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): I… I. I’m more myself when pondering on\nanswers that aren’t there, than turning away from them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는… 나는. 없는 답을 찾으려 고민하는 게\n눈을 돌리는 것보다 더 나다운 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Those questions and confusions are a part of\nme, and a part of this world that surrounds me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모든 의문과 혼돈 역시 나의 일부이자,\n나를 감싸고 있는 세계의 일부인걸.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t look away from things I’ve already\nrealized, just because they’re scary or troubling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이미 인식해 버린 것들을 두렵고 어렵다는\n이유만으로 못 본 척 살아갈 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Those who leap into the\nabyss are the strongest…)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (암흑으로 뛰어드는 자가 가장 강하다….)

English (United States)(en-US): (Those who don’t look away from the dark.\nThose who gaze within and beyond the self.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어둠으로부터 눈 돌리지 않는 자들. 내면과\n세계의 혼란을 낱낱이 그대로 바라보려는 자들.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Yes. I don’t want to live with only one eye open.)|(I don’t want to. But I have to admit that it’s braver.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그래, 나 역시 한쪽 눈만 뜨고 살고 싶진 않아.)|(여전히 굳이 싶어. 하지만 용감하다는 건 부정할 수 없다.)

English (United States)(en-US): That’s brave of you, Dot. You’ve really grown.|You’re on your way to becoming a philosopher…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 용감하다. 뭉치, 정말 강해졌구나.|이러다 뭉치가 아주 유명한 철학자가 되면 어쩌지….

English (United States)(en-US): No, I won’t. I’ll die as a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 일은 없을 거야. 난 꿈이 되어 죽을 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Well… yes.|Yes… (Knowing it doesn’t make it any less sadder.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어어… 어.|응…. (슬퍼진다.)

English (United States)(en-US): But above all, I’m glad I can share it with you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 무엇보다, 너와 대화할 수 있다는 사실이 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): Sharing my doubts with you always helped flesh\nout my thoughts, and took me closer to ‘growth’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 고민을 나누면 늘 사고가 심화되는 감각을\n느꼈고, 그 확장을 통해 ‘성장’에 가까워졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): And our hearts have grown fonder. We’ve\npeered into each other’s dark corners.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리의 마음도 더욱 깊어졌겠지.\n서로의 암흑까지 들춰 본 친구가 된 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, Dot. I’m glad I could\nhave been here for yours.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 뭉치, 너의 암흑을 토닥여 줄 수 있어 기뻤어.

English (United States)(en-US): And mine too… was consoled\nwithout even knowing it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 나의 암흑 역시… 모르는\n새에 위로받을 때가 많았지.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. All the pain, the loss, and questions\nthat burrowed into the gaps of the Dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 고통이, 결핍이, 암흑 사이사이를\n파고들던 수많은 질문들이.

English (United States)(en-US): They all merged into a single possibility,\nthrough the act of pondering.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고민의 행위로 하나의 가능성이 된 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And it shaped our relationship.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것은 너와의 관계를 결국 안전하게 빚어 냈어.

English (United States)(en-US): It helped me bear the past,\nand guided me to the future.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 과거의 것을 견딜 수 있게, 그렇게\n미래로 나아갈 수 있게 만들어 줬어.

English (United States)(en-US): The Dark is a place that reminds me of what\ntruly matters and deserves pondering,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑은 내가 정말 고민해야 할\n중요한 생각을 일깨워 주는,

English (United States)(en-US): perhaps one that is owed my thanks.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 고마운 장소인지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve never thought about whether\nto dive into the dark until now…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑으로 파고들어야 해? 라는\n생각을 이전에는 해 본 적이 없어….

English (United States)(en-US): If the Dark has made such questions for us.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑이 우리에게 그런 중요한 질문을 만들어 준 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): Will looking into the Dark take me closer to myself?|What do I do after leaping into the dark?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑을 들여다보면 자기에게로 가까워질 수 있을까?|용기 있게 암흑에 뛰어든 후, 그 후에 난 뭘 해야 하지?

English (United States)(en-US): The Dark has done its part\nby building on the questions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 질문을 만들어 준 것에서 암흑의 역할은 끝난 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): All that is left is to come to a decision.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 생각하면 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): To open your eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 뜨겠다고.

English (United States)(en-US): To face the pain and struggle\nof the fog head on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴롭고 어려운 안개의 감각들을\n있는 그대로 직시하겠다고.

English (United States)(en-US): And when you make up your\nmind and truly open your eyes,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결심하고 난 후에 정말로 ‘눈을 뜨면’

English (United States)(en-US): the Dark is no longer scary.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑은 더 이상 두렵지 않은 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Only then will I be able to fall in\nline with it, and offer it my gratitude…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 기꺼이 암흑과 나란히 서서,\n고마웠다고 말해 줄 수 있을 것 같아….
